com.hr.fer.zemris.parpro.cf

Class Game<S,M,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hr.fer.zemris.parpro.cf.Game<S,M,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - type of the state
    M - type of the move
    P - type of the player
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectFour

    public abstract class Game<S,M,P>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class abstracting a two-player deterministic perfect-information zero-sum game.

    Game described above at each moment is in some state. Players make moves and thus change the mentioned state. The state and move objects are of generic type. Player is also generic, although only names (String) of the players are currently needed. So it is necessary for a "Player"-object to override toString method of Object superclass.

    Class itself is abstract. It only provides bodies of functions that are same for all derived classes. Concrete classes need to provide concrete types of state and move in addition to implementing abstract methods.

    Objects of this type are supposed to be serialized and sent over socket.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(P firstPlayer,
            P secondPlayer)
        Base constructor for creating "Game"-objects. By convention, the first player provided in constructor starts the game, in other words makes the first move.
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - player #1 that takes part in the game
        secondPlayer - player #2 that takes part in the game

        Returns:

      • getLegalMoves

        public abstract java.util.List<M> getLegalMoves()
        Getter that returns all legal moves available from current state.
        Returns:
        all possible legal moves (as a list object)

      • performMove

        public final void performMove(M move)
        Makes changes to the current state by applying specified move. This method only serves as a template method.
        The essential part of the job, that is changing the internals (state of the game) is delegated to the abstract method of similar name.
        Parameters:
        move -

      • changeState

        protected abstract void changeState(M move)
        Abstract method that changes the state of the game according to some internal logic of a derived class. Stupidity of Java protected access modifier is visible here.
        This method should only be visible to subclasses of a "Game"-class.
        Parameters:
        move - Move object that ignites the change.
